description: Creating a secure AWS environment using CDK for Terraform with Go, designed to manage a web application hosting use case
requirements: Define infrastructure using CDK for Terraform with Go
Secure S3 buckets using AWS KMS for encryption
Use IAM roles and policies to enforce least privilege access to resources
Configure security groups to only permit incoming traffic over HTTPS (port 443)
Ensure that all data communications between AWS services are encrypted in transit
Set up CloudWatch alarms to monitor and alert on unauthorized access attempts or IAM policy violations
constraints: Use CDK for Terraform with Go to define the infrastructure
Ensure the use of AWS Key Management Service (KMS) to encrypt S3 buckets
Utilize IAM roles and policies to restrict access according to the principle of least privilege
Implement security groups to allow traffic only on port 443 for HTTPS
Enforce encryption in transit for any data or communications between services
Create alarms for any unauthorized access attempts or policy violations using CloudWatch
author: iamarpit-turing
